text: today another in a long line of
fantastic one-pot pastas the recipe
today is for shrimp with Gemelli and
feta it's so fresh and delicious and
just right for spring start off by
slicing four cloves of garlic very
thinly in here which is a straight sided
skillet I have two cups of water and a
can of chicken broth this is 12 ounces
of Gemelli and it goes right in with
liquid it seems really crazy the liquids
not boiling yet add your garlic and what
you want to do is bring this to a boil
and cook it stirring until it's almost
done about three minutes less than the
package direction one more thing that
goes in here two tablespoons of olive
oil one two and a little bit of salt and
pepper the cool thing about these one
pot pastas is a everything cooks in one
pot no draining no boiling an extra pot
of water none of that and because you're
doing that what happens is you get this
really thick creamy sauce that's
thickened by the starch of the pasta
this is almost done so it's time to add
the shrimp I have 12 ounces of large
shrimp peeled deveined and I removed the
tail you can leave them on if you like
that little handle eight ounces of sugar
snap peas that have been cut into 1-inch
pieces they're trimmed already half a
cup of feta cheese crumbled a couple
tablespoons of dill and some lemon zest
I'm gonna do some lemon zest in here and
then some more four servings so about a
teaspoon in here and so at this point
really the pasta is almost done the
shrimp should only take a couple of
minutes to cook through same thing for
the sugar snap peas and this is
happening very quickly and the sauce
which is created by the stock and the
water is nice and creamy and thick
already you can see just enough starch
from the pasta to make a thick and
creamy sauce with shrimp you really
don't want to overcook them or they get
tough and hideous so just keep an eye on
them and when they fully curl up and
look pink bright pink they should be
done and they will continue to cook in
the hot dish after
so be very careful not to overdo it
same thing with the sugar snap peas they
should be bright green tender crisp
alright I'm actually turning this off
it's not quite quite done but I'm just
gonna continue stirring it the feta has
melted in here and become part of the
sauce so I have additional feta to serve
on the top just for a little brightness
and a little more dill let's boot it up
I get overly excited when things work
out so a little bit of feta cheese a bit
of dill lemon zest so pretty right let's
see if it's delicious mmm mmm it's
bright and fresh and springy and perfect
for you tonight
